segment.source: IEM-configured settings have been deprecated for Internet Explorer 10 and newer.
segment.target: IEM-configured settings have been deprecated for Internet Explorer 10 and newer.

segment.source: Use this topic to learn where to go to fix the affected settings through Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), or the IEAK.
segment.target: Use this topic to learn where to go to fix the affected settings through Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), or the IEAK.

segment.source: Missing Internet Explorer Maintenance settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Missing Internet Explorer Maintenance settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Missing Internet Explorer Maintenance settings for Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Missing Internet Explorer Maintenance settings for Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: The Internet Explorer Maintenance (IEM) settings have been deprecated in favor of Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), and the IE Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11).
segment.target: The Internet Explorer Maintenance (IEM) settings have been deprecated in favor of Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), and the IE Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11).

segment.source: Because of this change, your IEM-configured settings will no longer work on computers running Internet Explorer 10 or newer.
segment.target: Because of this change, your IEM-configured settings will no longer work on computers running Internet Explorer 10 or newer.

segment.source: To fix this, you need to update the affected settings using Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), or IE Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11).
segment.target: To fix this, you need to update the affected settings using Group Policy Preferences, Administrative Templates (.admx), or IE Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11).

segment.source: Because Group Policy Preferences and IEAK 11 run using asynchronous processes, you should choose to use only one of the tools within each group of settings.
segment.target: Because Group Policy Preferences and IEAK 11 run using asynchronous processes, you should choose to use only one of the tools within each group of settings.

segment.source: For example, using only IEAK 11 in the Security settings or Group Policy Preferences within the Internet Zone settings.
segment.target: For example, using only IEAK 11 in the Security settings or Group Policy Preferences within the Internet Zone settings.

segment.source: Also, it's important to remember that policy is enforced and can't be changed by the user, while preferences are configured, but can be changed by the user.
segment.target: Also, it's important to remember that policy is enforced and can't be changed by the user, while preferences are configured, but can be changed by the user.

segment.source: For more information about all of the new options and Group Policy, see:
segment.target: For more information about all of the new options and Group Policy, see:

segment.source: Group policy preferences and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Group policy preferences and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11) - Administration Guide for IT Pros
segment.target: Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 (IEAK 11) - Administration Guide for IT Pros

segment.source: Group Policy Settings Reference for Windows and Windows Server
segment.target: Group Policy Settings Reference for Windows and Windows Server

segment.target: Group Policy ADMX Syntax Reference Guide

segment.source: Enable and Disable Settings in a Preference Item
segment.target: Enable and Disable Settings in a Preference Item

segment.source: IEM replacements
segment.target: IEM replacements

segment.source: The IEM settings have replacements you can use in either Group Policy Preferences or IEAK 11.
segment.target: The IEM settings have replacements you can use in either Group Policy Preferences or IEAK 11.

segment.source: Browser user interface replacements
segment.target: Browser user interface replacements

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Browser title
segment.target: Browser title

segment.source: Lets you customize the text that shows up in the title bar of the browser.
segment.target: Lets you customize the text that shows up in the title bar of the browser.

segment.source: On the Browser User Interface page of IEAK 11, click Customize Title Bars, and then type the text that appears on the title bar of the Title Bar Text box.
segment.target: On the Browser User Interface page of IEAK 11, click Customize Title Bars, and then type the text that appears on the title bar of the Title Bar Text box.

segment.source: Your text is appended to the text," Microsoft Internet Explorer provided by".
segment.target: Your text is appended to the text," Microsoft Internet Explorer provided by".

segment.source: Browser toolbar customizations (background and buttons)
segment.target: Browser toolbar customizations (background and buttons)

segment.source: Lets you customize the buttons on the browser toolbar.
segment.target: Lets you customize the buttons on the browser toolbar.

segment.source: Buttons.
segment.target: Buttons.

segment.source: Customizes the buttons on the Internet Explorer 11 toolbar.
segment.target: Customizes the buttons on the Internet Explorer 11 toolbar.

segment.source: Background.
segment.target: Background.

segment.source: No longer available.
segment.target: No longer available.

segment.source: On the Browser User Interface page of IEAK 11, click Add, type your new toolbar caption, action, and icon, and if the button should appear by default, and then click OK.
segment.target: On the Browser User Interface page of IEAK 11, click Add, type your new toolbar caption, action, and icon, and if the button should appear by default, and then click OK.

segment.source: You can also edit, remove, or delete an existing toolbar button from this page.
segment.target: You can also edit, remove, or delete an existing toolbar button from this page.

segment.source: Custom logo and animated bitmaps
segment.target: Custom logo and animated bitmaps

segment.source: Lets you replace the static and animated logos in the upper-right corner of the IE window with customized logos.
segment.target: Lets you replace the static and animated logos in the upper-right corner of the IE window with customized logos.

segment.source: This setting isn't available anymore.
segment.target: This setting isn't available anymore.

segment.source: Connection replacements
segment.target: Connection replacements

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Connection settings
segment.target: Connection settings

segment.source: Lets you import your connection settings from a previously set up computer.
segment.target: Lets you import your connection settings from a previously set up computer.

segment.source: These settings define how your employees interact with the connection settings on the System Polices and Restrictions page.
segment.target: These settings define how your employees interact with the connection settings on the System Polices and Restrictions page.

segment.source: You can also remove old dial-up connections settings from your employee's computers.
segment.target: You can also remove old dial-up connections settings from your employee's computers.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Connections tab, and set up your proxy settings.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Connections tab, and set up your proxy settings.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: On the Connection Settings page of IEAK 11, change your connection settings, including importing your current connection settings and deleting existing dial-up connection settings (as needed).
segment.target: On the Connection Settings page of IEAK 11, change your connection settings, including importing your current connection settings and deleting existing dial-up connection settings (as needed).

segment.source: Automatic browser configuration
segment.target: Automatic browser configuration

segment.source: Lets you update your employee's computer after you've deployed IE11, by specifying a URL to an .ins file, an auto-proxy URL, or both.
segment.target: Lets you update your employee's computer after you've deployed IE11, by specifying a URL to an .ins file, an auto-proxy URL, or both.

segment.source: You can decide when the update occurs, in minutes.
segment.target: You can decide when the update occurs, in minutes.

segment.source: Typing zero, or not putting in any number, means that automatic configuration only happens after the browser is started and used to go to a page.
segment.target: Typing zero, or not putting in any number, means that automatic configuration only happens after the browser is started and used to go to a page.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Automatic Configuration tab, and then add your URL.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Automatic Configuration tab, and then add your URL.

segment.source: On the Automatic Configuration page of IEAK 11, modify the configuration settings, including providing the URL to an .ins file or an auto-proxy site.
segment.target: On the Automatic Configuration page of IEAK 11, modify the configuration settings, including providing the URL to an .ins file or an auto-proxy site.

segment.source: Proxy settings
segment.target: Proxy settings

segment.source: Lets you specify your proxy servers.
segment.target: Lets you specify your proxy servers.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Connections tab, click LAN Settings, and then choose whether to turn on automatic detection of your configuration settings and if you want to use proxy servers.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Connections tab, click LAN Settings, and then choose whether to turn on automatic detection of your configuration settings and if you want to use proxy servers.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: On the Proxy Settings page of IEAK 11, turn on your proxy settings, adding your proxy server addresses and exceptions.
segment.target: On the Proxy Settings page of IEAK 11, turn on your proxy settings, adding your proxy server addresses and exceptions.

segment.source: User Agent string
segment.target: User Agent string

segment.source: Lets the browser provide identification to visited servers.
segment.target: Lets the browser provide identification to visited servers.

segment.source: This string is often used to keep Internet traffic statistics.
segment.target: This string is often used to keep Internet traffic statistics.

segment.source: This setting isn't available anymore.
segment.target: This setting isn't available anymore.

segment.source: URLs replacements
segment.target: URLs replacements

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Favorites and links
segment.target: Favorites and links

segment.source: Lets you use custom URLs for the Favorites and Links folders.
segment.target: Lets you use custom URLs for the Favorites and Links folders.

segment.source: You can also specify the folder order, disable IE Suggested Sites, and import an existing folder structure.
segment.target: You can also specify the folder order, disable IE Suggested Sites, and import an existing folder structure.

segment.source: On the Favorites, Favorites Bar and Feeds page of IEAK 11, add your custom URLs to the Favorites, Favorites Bar, or RSS Feeds folders, or create new folders.
segment.target: On the Favorites, Favorites Bar and Feeds page of IEAK 11, add your custom URLs to the Favorites, Favorites Bar, or RSS Feeds folders, or create new folders.

segment.source: You can also edit, test, or remove your URLs, sort the list order, or disable IE Suggested Sites.
segment.target: You can also edit, test, or remove your URLs, sort the list order, or disable IE Suggested Sites.

segment.source: Important URLs
segment.target: Important URLs

segment.source: Lets you add custom Home pages that can open different tabs.
segment.target: Lets you add custom Home pages that can open different tabs.

segment.source: You can also add a Support page that shows up when an employee clicks online Help.
segment.target: You can also add a Support page that shows up when an employee clicks online Help.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the General tab, and add your custom Home page.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the General tab, and add your custom Home page.

segment.source: On the Important URLs - Home page and Support page of IEAK 11, add the custom URLs to your Home and Support pages.
segment.target: On the Important URLs - Home page and Support page of IEAK 11, add the custom URLs to your Home and Support pages.

segment.source: You can also click to retain the previous home page information when the user upgrades to a newer version of IE.
segment.target: You can also click to retain the previous home page information when the user upgrades to a newer version of IE.

segment.source: Security Zones and Content Ratings
segment.target: Security Zones and Content Ratings

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Security zones
segment.target: Security zones

segment.source: Lets you change your security settings, by zone
segment.target: Lets you change your security settings, by zone

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Security tab, and update your security settings, based on zone.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Security tab, and update your security settings, based on zone.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: On the Security and Privacy Settings page of IEAK 11, choose your Security Zones and Privacy setting, changing it, as necessary.
segment.target: On the Security and Privacy Settings page of IEAK 11, choose your Security Zones and Privacy setting, changing it, as necessary.

segment.source: Content ratings
segment.target: Content ratings

segment.source: Lets you change your content ratings so your employees can't view sites with risky content.
segment.target: Lets you change your content ratings so your employees can't view sites with risky content.

segment.source: On the Security and Privacy Settings page of IEAK 11, choose your Content Ratings setting, changing it, as necessary.
segment.target: On the Security and Privacy Settings page of IEAK 11, choose your Content Ratings setting, changing it, as necessary.

segment.source: Authenticode settings
segment.target: Authenticode settings

segment.source: Lets you pick your trustworthy software publishers and stop your employees from adding new, untrusted publishers while browsing.
segment.target: Lets you pick your trustworthy software publishers and stop your employees from adding new, untrusted publishers while browsing.

segment.source: These settings aren't available anymore.
segment.target: These settings aren't available anymore.

segment.source: Programs
segment.target: Programs

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Programs
segment.target: Programs

segment.source: Lets you import your default program settings, which specify the programs Windows uses for each Internet service.
segment.target: Lets you import your default program settings, which specify the programs Windows uses for each Internet service.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Programs tab, and choose how to open IE11 links.
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Programs tab, and choose how to open IE11 links.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: On the Programs page of IEAK 11, choose whether to customize or import your program settings.
segment.target: On the Programs page of IEAK 11, choose whether to customize or import your program settings.

segment.source: Advanced IEM settings
segment.target: Advanced IEM settings

segment.source: The Advanced IEM settings, including Corporate and Internet settings, were also deprecated.
segment.target: The Advanced IEM settings, including Corporate and Internet settings, were also deprecated.

segment.source: However, they also have replacements you can use in either Group Policy Preferences or IEAK 11.
segment.target: However, they also have replacements you can use in either Group Policy Preferences or IEAK 11.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Advanced IEM Settings were shown under Programs and only available when running in Preference mode.
segment.target: Advanced IEM Settings were shown under Programs and only available when running in Preference mode.

segment.source: IEM setting
segment.target: IEM setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Replacement tool
segment.target: Replacement tool

segment.source: Corporate settings
segment.target: Corporate settings

segment.source: Specifies the location of the file with the settings you use to make IE work best in your organization.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the file with the settings you use to make IE work best in your organization.

segment.source: On the Additional Settings page of IEAK 11, expand Corporate Settings, and then customize how your organization handles temporary Internet files, code downloads, menu items, and toolbar buttons.
segment.target: On the Additional Settings page of IEAK 11, expand Corporate Settings, and then customize how your organization handles temporary Internet files, code downloads, menu items, and toolbar buttons.

segment.source: Internet settings
segment.target: Internet settings

segment.source: Specifies the location of the file that includes your default IE settings.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the file that includes your default IE settings.

segment.source: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Advanced tab, and then update your Internet-related settings, as required
segment.target: In the Internet Settings Group Policy Preferences dialog box, click the Advanced tab, and then update your Internet-related settings, as required

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: On the Additional Settings page of IEAK 11, expand Internet Settings, and then customize your default values in the Internet Options dialog box.
segment.target: On the Additional Settings page of IEAK 11, expand Internet Settings, and then customize your default values in the Internet Options dialog box.
